meanings.definition: Quats (noun): a colloquial term for quadriceps muscles
meanings.sent1: After exercising, my quats were sore from all the squats I did.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's powerful quats helped him sprint to the finish line.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my quats were so strong, I could probably kick a soccer ball into space!
meanings.sent4: Her quats were like springs, propelling her effortlessly through the air.
meanings.sent5: The image of his bulging quats was burned into my memory.

meanings.definition: Quats (verb): to quickly move or run
meanings.sent1: The cat will quats across the room when it hears the sound of a treat bag.
meanings.sent2: I had to quats to catch the bus before it drove away.
meanings.sent3: I watched in amusement as the squirrel quats around the tree in search of nuts.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to quats by as we raced against the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the park as they quats around playing tag.

meanings.definition: Quats (adjective): describing something or someone that is quick or fast
meanings.sent1: The cheetah is known for its quats movements when hunting prey.
meanings.sent2: The quats rabbit darted across the field, leaving a trail of dust behind.
meanings.sent3: The quats delivery service promised to bring your package in record time.
meanings.sent4: His quats reflexes allowed him to dodge the incoming ball effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The quats pace of the race left the spectators breathless with excitement.
